article: Whenever my child caused me to change my schedule, I thought to myself, "We don't have time for this." _ the two words I most commonly spoke to my child were: "Hurry up." But almost three years ago I made my promise to slow down and I began my journey to pay more attention to what 43 _ in life. Actually, my younger _ often reminds me of why I must keep trying to slow down. In fact, the other day, she reminded me once again. The two of us had taken a bike ride to the 45 _ . After buying a cool ice cream for her, my daughter sat down at a table46 _ looking at the ice cream she held in her hand. Suddenly a look of worry appeared on her face. "Do I have to rush, Mama?" I nearly _ . Perhaps the pains of a 49 _ life don't ever completely disappear, I thought sadly. As my child looked up at me waiting to know _ she could take her time, I knew I had a choice . I could sit there in _ thinking about the number of times when I told my child to _ through life..., or I could just try to do things _ . I chose the latter  "You don't have to rush. Just take your time," I said _ . Then we _ side by side talking merrily. There were even moments when we sat in _ , only smiling at each other . When she got to the last bite , she held out the ice cream for me. "I _ the last bite for you, Mama," my daughter said _ . I realized I just got the deal of a lifetime. I gave my child a little time...and in return , she gave me her last bite and reminded me that things taste sweeter and love comes _ when you stop rushing through life.
